Browse the source code of netbsd/external/mpl/bind/dist/bin/confgen/rndc-confgen.c

1/* $NetBSD: rndc-confgen.c,v 1.3 2019/01/09 16:54:58 christos Exp $ */
2

14/*! \file */
15
16/**
17 * rndc-confgen generates configuration files for rndc. It can be used
18 * as a convenient alternative to writing the rndc.conf file and the
19 * corresponding controls and key statements in named.conf by hand.
20 * Alternatively, it can be run with the -a option to set up a
21 * rndc.key file and avoid the need for a rndc.conf file and a
22 * controls statement altogether.
23 */
24
25#include <config.h>
26
27#include <stdarg.h>
28#include <stdbool.h>
29#include <stdlib.h>
30
31#include <isc/assertions.h>
32#include <isc/base64.h>
33#include <isc/buffer.h>
34#include <isc/commandline.h>
35#include <isc/file.h>
36#include <isc/mem.h>
37#include <isc/net.h>
38#include <isc/print.h>
39#include <isc/result.h>
40#include <isc/string.h>
41#include <isc/time.h>
42#include <isc/util.h>
43
44#include <pk11/site.h>
45
46#include <dns/keyvalues.h>
47#include <dns/name.h>
48
49#include <dst/dst.h>
50#include <confgen/os.h>
51
52#include "util.h"
53#include "keygen.h"
54
55#define DEFAULT_KEYNAME "rndc-key"
56#define DEFAULT_SERVER "127.0.0.1"
57#define DEFAULT_PORT 953
58
59static char program[256];
60const char *progname;
61
62bool verbose = false;
63
64const char *keyfile, *keydef;
65
66ISC_PLATFORM_NORETURN_PRE static void
67usage(int status) ISC_PLATFORM_NORETURN_POST;
68
69static void
70usage(int status) {
71
72 fprintf(stderr, "\
73Usage:\n\
74 %s [-a] [-b bits] [-c keyfile] [-k keyname] [-p port] \
75[-s addr] [-t chrootdir] [-u user]\n\
76 -a: generate just the key clause and write it to keyfile (%s)\n\
77 -A alg: algorithm (default hmac-sha256)\n\
78 -b bits: from 1 through 512, default 256; total length of the secret\n\
79 -c keyfile: specify an alternate key file (requires -a)\n\
80 -k keyname: the name as it will be used in named.conf and rndc.conf\n\
81 -p port: the port named will listen on and rndc will connect to\n\
82 -s addr: the address to which rndc should connect\n\
83 -t chrootdir: write a keyfile in chrootdir as well (requires -a)\n\
84 -u user: set the keyfile owner to \"user\" (requires -a)\n",
85 progname, keydef);
86
87 exit (status);
88}
89
90int
91main(int argc, char **argv) {
92 bool show_final_mem = false;
93 isc_buffer_t key_txtbuffer;
94 char key_txtsecret[256];
95 isc_mem_t *mctx = NULL;
96 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
97 const char *keyname = NULL;
98 const char *serveraddr = NULL;
99 dns_secalg_t alg;
100 const char *algname;
101 char *p;
102 int ch;
103 int port;
104 int keysize = -1;
105 struct in_addr addr4_dummy;
106 struct in6_addr addr6_dummy;
107 char *chrootdir = NULL;
108 char *user = NULL;
109 bool keyonly = false;
110 int len;
111
112 keydef = keyfile = RNDC_KEYFILE;
113
114 result = isc_file_progname(*argv, program, sizeof(program));
115 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
116 memmove(program, "rndc-confgen", 13);
117 progname = program;
118
119 keyname = DEFAULT_KEYNAME;
120 alg = DST_ALG_HMACSHA256;
121 serveraddr = DEFAULT_SERVER;
122 port = DEFAULT_PORT;
123
124 isc_commandline_errprint = false;
125
126 while ((ch = isc_commandline_parse(argc, argv,
127 "aA:b:c:hk:Mmp:r:s:t:u:Vy")) != -1)
128 {
129 switch (ch) {
130 case 'a':
131 keyonly = true;
132 break;
133 case 'A':
134 algname = isc_commandline_argument;
135 alg = alg_fromtext(algname);
136 if (alg == DST_ALG_UNKNOWN)
137 fatal("Unsupported algorithm '%s'", algname);
138 break;
139 case 'b':
140 keysize = strtol(isc_commandline_argument, &p, 10);
141 if (*p != '\0' || keysize < 0)
142 fatal("-b requires a non-negative number");
143 break;
144 case 'c':
145 keyfile = isc_commandline_argument;
146 break;
147 case 'h':
148 usage(0);
149 case 'k':
150 case 'y': /* Compatible with rndc -y. */
151 keyname = isc_commandline_argument;
152 break;
153 case 'M':
154 isc_mem_debugging = ISC_MEM_DEBUGTRACE;
155 break;
156
157 case 'm':
158 show_final_mem = true;
159 break;
160 case 'p':
161 port = strtol(isc_commandline_argument, &p, 10);
162 if (*p != '\0' || port < 0 || port > 65535)
163 fatal("port '%s' out of range",
164 isc_commandline_argument);
165 break;
166 case 'r':
167 fatal("The -r option has been deprecated.");
168 break;
169 case 's':
170 serveraddr = isc_commandline_argument;
171 if (inet_pton(AF_INET, serveraddr, &addr4_dummy) != 1 &&
172 inet_pton(AF_INET6, serveraddr, &addr6_dummy) != 1)
173 fatal("-s should be an IPv4 or IPv6 address");
174 break;
175 case 't':
176 chrootdir = isc_commandline_argument;
177 break;
178 case 'u':
179 user = isc_commandline_argument;
180 break;
181 case 'V':
182 verbose = true;
183 break;
184 case '?':
185 if (isc_commandline_option != '?') {
186 fprintf(stderr, "%s: invalid argument -%c\n",
187 program, isc_commandline_option);
188 usage(1);
189 } else
190 usage(0);
191 break;
192 default:
193 fprintf(stderr, "%s: unhandled option -%c\n",
194 program, isc_commandline_option);
195 exit(1);
196 }
197 }
198
199 argc -= isc_commandline_index;
200 argv += isc_commandline_index;
201 POST(argv);
202
203 if (argc > 0)
204 usage(1);
205
206 if (alg == DST_ALG_HMACMD5) {
207 fprintf(stderr,
208 "warning: use of hmac-md5 for RNDC keys "
209 "is deprecated; hmac-sha256 is now recommended.\n");
210 }
211
212 if (keysize < 0)
213 keysize = alg_bits(alg);
214 algname = alg_totext(alg);
215
216 DO("create memory context", isc_mem_create(0, 0, &mctx));
217 isc_buffer_init(&key_txtbuffer, &key_txtsecret, sizeof(key_txtsecret));
218
219 generate_key(mctx, alg, keysize, &key_txtbuffer);
220
221 if (keyonly) {
222 write_key_file(keyfile, chrootdir == NULL ? user : NULL,
223 keyname, &key_txtbuffer, alg);
224
225 if (chrootdir != NULL) {
226 char *buf;
227 len = strlen(chrootdir) + strlen(keyfile) + 2;
228 buf = isc_mem_get(mctx, len);
229 if (buf == NULL)
230 fatal("isc_mem_get(%d) failed\n", len);
231 snprintf(buf, len, "%s%s%s", chrootdir,
232 (*keyfile != '/') ? "/" : "", keyfile);
233
234 write_key_file(buf, user, keyname, &key_txtbuffer, alg);
235 isc_mem_put(mctx, buf, len);
236 }
237 } else {
238 printf("\
239# Start of rndc.conf\n\
240key \"%s\" {\n\
241 algorithm %s;\n\
242 secret \"%.*s\";\n\
243};\n\
244\n\
245options {\n\
246 default-key \"%s\";\n\
247 default-server %s;\n\
248 default-port %d;\n\
249};\n\
250# End of rndc.conf\n\
251\n\
252# Use with the following in named.conf, adjusting the allow list as needed:\n\
253# key \"%s\" {\n\
254# algorithm %s;\n\
255# secret \"%.*s\";\n\
256# };\n\
257# \n\
258# controls {\n\
259# inet %s port %d\n\
260# allow { %s; } keys { \"%s\"; };\n\
261# };\n\
262# End of named.conf\n",
263 keyname, algname,
264 (int)isc_buffer_usedlength(&key_txtbuffer),
265 (char *)isc_buffer_base(&key_txtbuffer),
266 keyname, serveraddr, port,
267 keyname, algname,
268 (int)isc_buffer_usedlength(&key_txtbuffer),
269 (char *)isc_buffer_base(&key_txtbuffer),
270 serveraddr, port, serveraddr, keyname);
271 }
272
273 if (show_final_mem)
274 isc_mem_stats(mctx, stderr);
275
276 isc_mem_destroy(&mctx);
277
278 return (0);
279}
280
